FuncDef:
The ds-lite session aging-time command sets the aging time for a specific or multiple types of DS-Lite sessions.
The undo ds-lite session aging-time command restores the default aging time for a specific or multiple types of DS-Lite sessions.
The default aging time for a specific or multiple types of DS-Lite sessions is the default aging time.
CLIs: ds-lite session aging-time { tcp | udp | icmp | fin-rst | syn | ftp | rtsp | sip | pptp } aging-time
undo ds-lite session aging-time { tcp | udp | icmp | fin-rst | syn | ftp | rtsp | sip | pptp } [ aging-time ]
undo ds-lite session aging-time fragment [ aging-time ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates TCP FIN and TCP RST DS-Lite sessions.
-

Specifies an aging time.
The aging time for fragment DS-Lite sessions is an integer ranging from 40 to 40000, in milliseconds. The aging time for other DS-Lite sessions is an integer ranging from 1 to 40000, seconds.

Indicates the aging time of the DS-Lite session table of the fragment type.
The aging time for fragment DS-Lite sessions is an integer ranging from 40 to 40000, in milliseconds. The aging time for other DS-Lite sessions is an integer ranging from 1 to 40000, seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The aging time of DS-Lite session entries of each protocol can be set. After the configured aging time elapses, DS-Lite session entries age, and system resources can be released.
The default aging time of TCP is 240sThe default aging time of UDP is 240sThe default aging time of ICMP is 20sThe default aging time of RTSP is 240sThe default aging time of fragment is 5000 msThe default aging time of fin-rst is 5sThe default aging time of syn is 5sThe default aging time of FTP is 600sThe default aging time of SIP is 800sThe default aging time of PPTP is 180s

Configuration Impact
After an aging time is set for a DS-Lite instance, this setting takes effect on the session established using the DS-Lite instance. If no aging time is set for a DS-Lite instance, a global aging time takes effect on the session established using the DS-Lite instance.
Precautions
The ds-lite session aging-time command takes effect only on the centralized-board.
